alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 4:02AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Expanding into Okeechobee, Southern Osceola, Martin, Saint Lucie, and Indian River Counties... At 400 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery, and traffic cameras, showed patchy dense fog had developed in Okeechobee and southern Osceola counties, and is expanding into inland Martin, Saint Lucie, and Indian River counties. Visibility reductions down to one quarter mile or less are occurring. Patchy fog is expected to push into coastal the coastal portions of Martin, Saint Lucie, and Indian River counties, possibly becoming locally dense in some spots. Prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility on the roads due to dense fog. Slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of driving distance between your car and the one in front of you. Fog will gradually dissipate by mid to late morning.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee; Osceola
